description.value:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save).

The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.

The hell hound breathes flames that deal [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save).

The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.
Longswords can be one‑edged or two‑edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.
A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

The bugbear marauder Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature that can't see them and doesn't know where they are. If the bugbear succeeds, they also deal fist damage to that creature.
The bugbear marauder gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.
